title: Upgrade tractor game to a 3D tractor–trolley farming game with updatable gameplay configuration

requirements.text: Implement a 3D version of the tractor game using React Three Fiber, including a controllable tractor with an attached trolley driving in a farm environment, while keeping the existing start/play/game-over/restart loop and supporting both keyboard and on-screen controls.

quotes: मुझे 3Dगेम टैक्टर ट्राली बाला गेम चाहिए जिसमें खेती-बाड़ी हो सके

acceptanceCriteria: The main gameplay scene renders in 3D (not a 2D/top-down canvas) using React Three Fiber.
The player controls a tractor with a visible attached trolley; movement works on desktop (keyboard) and mobile (on-screen controls).
The game still has the screens/loop: start -> play -> game over -> restart.

requirements.text: Add farming gameplay activities as core loops (e.g., plowing, sowing, watering, harvesting) that can be performed with the tractor–trolley in the 3D world, with clear objectives and completion/failure conditions tied into the game loop.
acceptanceCriteria: At least 3 distinct farming activities are playable in-game (e.g., plowing, sowing, harvesting or watering).
Each activity has a clear objective shown in the UI (e.g., complete X rows/plots within time or avoid missing plots).
Completing an activity advances progress and/or score; failure routes to game-over with a restart option.

requirements.text: Extend the content-driven GameConfig so 3D scene parameters and farming-activity parameters can be updated from the backend, and ensure the frontend loads and applies this GameConfig on startup and during admin updates (without requiring gameplay code changes for tuning/balancing).

quotes: और मैं उसमें नई अपडेट डाल सकूं

acceptanceCriteria: Backend GameConfig includes fields to tune 3D gameplay and farming activities (e.g., tractor speed, turning, field/plot layout, activity durations/targets, difficulty settings).
Frontend loads GameConfig from the backend on startup and uses it to drive gameplay tuning (speed, objectives, layout, etc.).
Admin-only UI can update the new GameConfig fields and changes take effect after reload (or via an explicit refresh action).

requirements.text: Add a Play Store–friendly delivery path by making the game UI fully mobile-responsive and adding developer documentation explaining how to wrap the web build in an Android WebView/wrapper for Play Store upload.

quotes: जिसे में प्ले स्टोर पर अपलोड कर सकूं

acceptanceCriteria: Game UI is responsive on common mobile viewport sizes, with touch-friendly controls and readable HUD.
Repository includes a short documentation page describing a WebView/wrapper approach to publish the web game to Play Store (without adding native Android code to this project).

constraints: Keep all Motoko logic in a single backend actor (backend/main.mo) per the single-actor architecture constraint.
Do not modify any frontend files under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose those components/hooks instead).
Do not introduce non-supported technologies (no external databases, no third-party auth beyond Internet Identity, no WebSockets).
nonGoals: Building or shipping a native Android (Kotlin/Java) app inside this codebase.
Actually uploading the app to the Play Store or managing Play Console assets/listing.
Advanced vehicle physics or realistic farming machinery simulation beyond simple arcade-style controls and interactions.
